description.narrative:
Since the inauguration of the Danish Parliamentary Ombudsman’s office in 1955, successive ombudsmen have travelled the world and shared infor-mation about the Danish Ombudsman institution and its work on protecting the legal rights of citizens and on promoting good administrative practice. This has taken place in such diverse countries as Ghana, Albania, Jordan, Vi-etnam, Uganda, Iran and China.
With the purpose of supporting the Ombudsman’s involvement in international activities and projects aimed at developing and strengthening democratic in-stitutions, good governance and good administrative practice, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ombudsman signed a 3-year collaboration agreement in 2000. Through the agreement, which has been renewed several times, the Ombudsman receives funds covering one position to participate in interna-tional activities and projects.
The agreement also stipulates that the Ministry and its embassies may draw from the Ombudsman’s experience in connection with counselling and assis-tance for the development and strengthening of democratic institutions in, par-ticularly, the world’s poorest countries.
The partner’s results description and results frameworks are global, general, and highly aggregated and the MFA core contribution is thus reflected in the overall results reporting by the partner. Please refer to the hyperlink below.
https://en.ombudsmanden.dk/international/the_work/#cp-title
